episodes.title: Examining Matthew 24, Part 13: The Parable of the Sheep and the Goats
episodes.description:
Witness leadership use the Parable of the Sheep and the Goats to claim that the salvation of the "Other Sheep" depends on their obedience to the instructions of the Governing Body.  They allege that this parable "proves" that there is a two-class system of salvation with 144,000 going to heaven, while the rest live as sinners on earth for the 1,000 years.  Is that the true meaning of this parable or do Witnesses have it all wrong?  Join us to examin the evidence and decide for yourself.

(Scriptures that show the real Christian hope: Matthew 5:9; 12:46-50; John 1:12; Romans 8:1-25; 9:25, 26; Galatians 3:26; 4:6, 7; Colossians 1:2; 1 Corinthians 15:42-49; 1 John 3:1-3; Revelation 12:10; 20:6)

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2020/05/22/examining-matthew-24-part-13-the-parable-of-the-sheep-and-the-goats/

To view all the Beroean Pickets videos, click on this link:

episodes.title: Examining Matthew 24, Part 12: Who is the Faithful and Discreet Slave?
episodes.description:
Jehovah's Witnesses contend that the men (currently 8) making up their governing body constitute a fulfillment of what they consider to be the prophecy of the faithful and discreet slave referred to at Matthew 24:45-47. Is this accurate or merely a self-serving interpretation?  If the latter, then what or who is the faithful and discreet slave, and what of the other three slaves that Jesus refers to in Luke's parallel account? 

This video will attempt to answer all these questions using Scriptural context and reasoning.

To view a transcript of this video, go to:  https://beroeans.net/2020/05/15/examining-matthew-24-part-12-the-faithful-and-discreet-slave/

To view all the Beroean Pickets videos, click on this link:

episodes.title: James Penton speaks about the origins of the teachings of Jehovah's Witnesses
episodes.description:
Witnesses are taught that Charles Taze Russell originated all the teachings that make Jehovah's Witnesses stand out from the other religions in Christendom.  This turns out to be untrue. In fact, it will surprise most Witnesses to learn that their millenarian teachings come from a Catholic priest, a Jesuit no less.  James Penton, a Canadian history professor and author of several scholarly books on Jehovah's Witnesses takes us back three centuries to the origin of many of the doctrines Witnesses mistakenly believe are theirs alone.

This is a link to the Golden Age article libeling Walter F. Salter: http://watchtowerdocuments.org/documents/1937_470_Golden_Age_May_5_1937.pdf

Email Addresses:
James Penton: mjpenton32@gmail.com.
Eric Wilson AKA Meleti Vivlon: meleti.vivlon@gmail.com

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2019/12/27/james-penton-speaks-about-the-origins-of-the-teachings-of-jehovahs-witnesses/

episodes.title: My Interview with famous Canadian "apostate" and renown author James Penton.
episodes.description:
James Penton is a university history professor, the author of several books on Jehovah's Witnesses, and himself from a fourth-generation witness family.  His so-called "apostasy" resulted when he dared to counsel the incipient Governing Body back in 1979 about the need to take responsibility and apologize for misleading the congregation of Jehovah's Witnesses worldwide over the 1975 end-of-the-world teaching.  He also scripturally challenged the teaching that the preaching work had to be done from door to door.  For this, he was harassed and hounded until finally, they disfellowshipped him.  As a result, about 80 Witnesses left the religion—about a third of all those in Lethbridge, Alberta—to worship God in line with real Bible truth.  The account of all that transpired in 1979/80 can be found in the book "Crisis of Allegiance - A Study of Dissent Among Jehovah's Witnesses".

This is a link to the Golden Age article libeling Walter F. Salter: http://watchtowerdocuments.org/documents/1937_470_Golden_Age_May_5_1937.pdf

This article discusses the Salter case as well as that of Olin Moyle: https://beroeans.net/2016/10/26/our-christian-life-and-ministry-review-oct-24-30/

For an analysis disproving the interpretation of Jehovah's Witnesses of scriptures that refer to house-to-house preaching, see this article series: https://beroeans.net/2018/11/22/theology-unique-to-jehovahs-witnesses-jws-part-1-the-ministry-method/

Email Addresses:
James Penton: mjpenton32@gmail.com.
Eric Wilson AKA Meleti Vivlon: meleti.vivlon@gmail.com

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2019/12/24/my-interview-with-famous-canadian-apostate-and-renown-author-james-penton/

episodes.description:

Was that answer limited to events in the first century, or did it have far reaching ramifications?  The answer to that question is both yes and no, as you will see from this video presentation.

episodes.title: An interview with my Aussie friend, Frank Poniris and why he left Jehovah's Witnesses
episodes.description:
Jehovah's Witnesses around the world are waking up to the hypocrisy of their leadership, not only in doctrinal deception, but in conduct that betrays their claim to be followers of Christ.  Our Australian brothers in particular bore witness to this hypocrisy as they watched the outrageous justification made by leaders of the Organization known as JW.org when trying to defend their policies on the treatment of pedophiles within their ranks.  But Frank's journey was more similar to mine in that it was the willful doctrinal falsehoods that forced him to find another way to worship God and obey the Christ.

Frank's YouTube Channel is https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNb0C-bFyleNPKU_Lh_yjsA

episodes.title: Examining Matthew 24, Part 3: Preaching in All the Inhabited Earth
episodes.description:
Was Matthew 24:14 given to us as a means to measure how close we are to the return of Jesus?  Does it speak of a worldwide preaching work to warn all humanity of their looming doom and eternal destruction?  Witnesses believe they alone have this commission and that their preaching work is life saving?  Is that the case, or are they actually working against God's purpose. This video will endeavour to answer those questions.

To review the article referenced in the video that provides a detailed analysis of the origin of the doctrine of the Other Sheep taught by Jehovah's Witnesses, click this link:
https://beroeans.net/2014/11/23/going-beyond-what-is-written/

J. F. RUTHERFORD REJECTS HOLY SPIRIT IN FAVOR OF ANGELIC REVELATION
"While Jesus was absent from them, and while he is engaged in ‘preparing the way before the Lord’ and before he comes to his temple, the holy spirit operates as an advocate, helper and comforter of and for all that have responded to the call for the kingdom. But when the Lord comes to his temple and gathers his approved ones into the temple, is there any further need for the office of the holy spirit as a helper or advocate? If not, then the advocacy of the holy spirit would there cease. Jesus, being in the temple and with his chosen ones, would act for them directly.

... now the Lord Jesus himself has returned, is in his temple, and, acting by and through his holy angels, puts it into the mind and heart of the remnant class to take positive action and to do a certain work;" Watchtower 1930 Sep 1 pp;262-263
"With the coming of the Lord to his temple and the gathering together unto himself of the chosen ones the holy spirit would there cease to function as a paraclete or advocate for the church. ... After the holy spirit as an advocate or paraclete ceased to function in behalf of the consecrated, then the angels are employed in behalf of those who are being made ready for the kingdom." Watchtower 1930 Jun 1 pp.166,167
"God uses angels to teach His people now on earth." The Golden Age 1933 Nov 8 p.69
"Certain duties and kingdom interests have been committed by the Lord to his angels, which include the transmission of information to God's anointed people on the earth for their aid and comfort. Even though we cannot understand how the angels transmit this information, we know that they do it." Preparation (1933) pp.36,37
"Enlightenment proceeds from Jehovah... and is given to the faithful anointed.... the remnant are instructed by the angels of the Lord. The remnant do not hear audible sounds, because such is not necessary. Jehovah has provided his own good way to convey thoughts to the minds of his anointed ones." Preparation (1933) p.64
"Judge Rutherford couldn't write these things unless he were used of God". Golden Age 1935 Oct 23 p.50
"No man can properly interpret prophecy, and the Lord sends his angels to transmit correct information to his people." Watchtower 1936 Feb 15 p.52

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2019/10/25/examining-matthew-24-part-3-preaching-in-all-the-inhabited-earth/

episodes.title: Examining Matthew 24, Part 1: The Question
episodes.description:
Jesus' last days prophecy cannot be properly understood until we understand the motivation behind the disciples' question that prompted it.  Why does Matthew's account differ from that of Mark and Luke?  When was the prophecy fulfilled, or is it still pending?  We will be analyzing the entire chapter of Matthew in this series in the hope of putting all doubts to rest concerning the meaning of this important chapter in Matthew's account of the life of Jesus.

REFERENCES:
NIV - New International Version
YLT - Young's Literal Translation
CEV - Contemporary English Version
ESV - English Standard Version
NWT - New World Translation

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2019/09/25/examining-matthew-24-part-1-the-question/

episodes.title: Is the Governing Body of Jehovah's Witnesses a False Prophet?
episodes.description:
There have been many prophetic failures over the years from the leadership of Jehovah's Witnesses, such as 1914, 1925, and 1975, not to mention the ongoing re-interpretations of the length of "this generation" expected to mark the nearness of Armageddon.  

Are we to dismiss these prophetic fiascoes as merely the best efforts of sincere, but imperfect men?  Or is there something more sinister at work here?

episodes.title: A Jehovah's Witnesses Elder on Trial for Apostasy
episodes.description:
Why would the elders want to disfellowship someone who hasn't been going to meetings for years and who no longer lives anywhere near their congregation territory?  The answer to that is evidenced by the amount of paranoia exhibited by these men claiming to be Christian as demonstrated by the exteme measures they go to in this video.  There is a valuable lesson to be learned concerning the true nature and purpose of the JW judicial system as evinced in this exchange between two different committees of Jehovah's Witnesses elders and a lone exJW.  By not being able to allow me to simply go away, they have provided a perfect opportunity to expose the wickedness of their so-called judicial process and show it up to be what is it, a modern reworking of the catholic inquisition of the Dark Ages.

To download the lawyer's letter to the Aldershot judicial committee, go here: https://beroeans.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Lawyer-Letter.pdf 

To download the final appeal letter to the Canada branch office of Jehovah's Witnesses, go here: https://beroeans.net/wp-content/uploads/2019/05/Appeal-to-Branch.pdf

episodes.title: Identifying True Worship, Part 2: Has Jehovah Always Had an Organization?
episodes.description:
When challenged about their beliefs, Witnesses often retreat behind a phalanx of objections such as: Where else would we go? or Jehovah has always had an organization and is there a better one than us? or We should just wait on Jehovah to fix things.  This video examines the validity of all these.

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2018/02/17/identifying-true-worship-part-2-has-jehovah-always-had-an-organization/

To view all the Beroean Pickets videos, click on this link:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1l1Ac6tb16thxKa96Gm7XA

If you would like to help us to continue in this work, click this link:
https://beroeans.net/support/

episodes.title: Identifying True Worship, Part 1: What Is Apostasy according to the Bible and Jehovah's Witnesses?
episodes.description:
Jehovah's Witnesses will often turn away from any Bible discussion that challenges their beliefs, using the excuse that they cannot listen to apostates.  This raises the question: Who is an apostate?  How does the Bible define apostasy, and are Witnesses adhering to the Bible definition, or using this as an excuse to turn a deaf ear to truth?

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2018/02/16/identifying-true-worship-part-1-what-is-apostasy/

To view all the Beroean Pickets videos, click on this link:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1l1Ac6tb16thxKa96Gm7XA

If you would like to help us to continue in this work, click this link:
https://beroeans.net/support/

episodes.title: Why I left Jehovah's Witnesses after serving as an Elder for over 40 Years
episodes.description:
What happens when the criteria Jehovah's Witnesses use to identify the true religion are applied to the Organization?  How well do we fare?  This series of videos explores those questions.

To view a transcript of this video, go to: https://beroeans.net/2018/02/15/identifying-true-worship-introduction/
